ResetKeys.description: This action resets the UEFI Secure Boot keys.
ResetKeys.longDescription: This action shall reset the UEFI Secure Boot key databases.  The `ResetAllKeysToDefault` value shall reset all UEFI Secure Boot key databases to their default values.  The `DeleteAllKeys` value shall delete the content of all UEFI Secure Boot key databases.  The `DeletePK` value shall delete the content of the PK Secure Boot key database.

ResetKeysType.description: The type of reset or delete to perform on the UEFI Secure Boot databases.
ResetKeysType.longDescription: This parameter shall specify the type of reset or delete to perform on the UEFI Secure Boot databases.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

enumDescriptions.DeleteAllKeys: Delete the contents of all UEFI Secure Boot key databases, including the PK key database.  This puts the system in Setup Mode.
enumDescriptions.DeletePK: Delete the contents of the PK UEFI Secure Boot database.  This puts the system in Setup Mode.
enumDescriptions.ResetAllKeysToDefault: Reset the contents of all UEFI Secure Boot key databases, including the PK key database, to the default values.

SecureBoot.description: The SecureBoot schema contains UEFI Secure Boot information and represents properties for managing the UEFI Secure Boot functionality of a system.
SecureBoot.longDescription: This resource contains UEFI Secure Boot information for a Redfish implementation.

Oem.longDescription: This property shall contain the OEM extensions.  All values for properties that this object contains shall conform to the Redfish Specification-described requirements.

SecureBootCurrentBoot.description: The UEFI Secure Boot state during the current boot cycle.
SecureBootCurrentBoot.longDescription: This property shall indicate the UEFI Secure Boot state during the current boot cycle.

SecureBootEnable.description: An indication of whether UEFI Secure Boot is enabled.
SecureBootEnable.longDescription: This property shall indicate whether the UEFI Secure Boot takes effect on next boot.  This property can be enabled in UEFI boot mode only.

SecureBootMode.description: The current UEFI Secure Boot Mode.
SecureBootMode.longDescription: This property shall contain the current UEFI Secure Boot mode, as defined in the UEFI Specification.

enumDescriptions.Disabled: UEFI Secure Boot is currently disabled.
enumDescriptions.Enabled: UEFI Secure Boot is currently enabled.

enumDescriptions.AuditMode: UEFI Secure Boot is currently in Audit Mode.
enumDescriptions.DeployedMode: UEFI Secure Boot is currently in Deployed Mode.
enumDescriptions.SetupMode: UEFI Secure Boot is currently in Setup Mode.
enumDescriptions.UserMode: UEFI Secure Boot is currently in User Mode.
